de.cocolab.reuse
Class CocktailReader

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.io.Reader
        |
        +--java.io.FilterReader
              |
              +--de.cocolab.reuse.CocktailReader
public class CocktailReader
extends java.io.FilterReader

Read formatted representations of objects from a text stream.

This class knows how various objects found in a Cocktail application are formatted for interchange with a Cocktail application written in a language other than Java. This class can read anything written by a CocktailWriter. It is not designed to be robust, so should not be used for human input. For example, if readI is called when the next section of input is not numeric, zero is returned; there is no way for the caller to detect that an invalid number rather than '0' was seen.

The input bytes are translated into characters according to the platform's default character encoding.

Version:
$Id: $

CocktailReader

public CocktailReader(java.io.InputStream in)
Create a new CocktailReader, from an existing InputStream. This convenience constructor creates the necessary intermediate InputStreamReader, which will convert bytes into characters using the default character encoding.

Parameters:
in - An input stream

Read characters into a portion of an array. This method will block until some input is available, an I/O error occurs, or the end of the stream is reached.

Overrides:
read in class java.io.FilterReader

readS

public void readS(java.lang.StringBuffer buffer)
           throws java.io.IOException
Fill a StringBuffer to capacity. All characters including white space are included - we do not stop at end of line.

Parameters:
buffer - The buffer to be filled. If the resulting length is less than capacity then end of file has been encountered.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

readL

public java.lang.StringBuffer readL()
                             throws java.io.IOException
Return a StringBuffer filled with a line of input, in other words up to but not including the next new line. The new line character is consumed but not copied to the result. For DOS / Unix compatibility CR characters are removed.

Returns:
The line read. There is no limit on the length of line read.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

The position read.

skipSpaces

public void skipSpaces()
                throws java.io.IOException
Skip spaces.

Consumes any space characters, so that the next character read is guaranteed not to be ' '.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs

skipToChar

public void skipToChar(char ch)
                throws java.io.IOException
Skip to the next occurence of a specified character.

Consumes characters until an occurrence of the specified character is seen or end of file is encountered.

Parameters:
ch - The character to be searched for. This must not be ␀.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs
